required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 14, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Nicotinamide Riboside in SARS-CoV-2 (COVID-19) Patients for Renal Protection
clinical_study.official_title: NIRVANA: NIcotinamide Riboside in SARS-CoV-2 pAtients for reNAl Protection

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio

collaborator.agency: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK)

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio

brief_summary.textblock: An interventional clinical trial using oral nicotinamide riboside (NR) in hospitalized patients with COVID-19 infection and acute kidney injury to determine the effect of NR on whole blood nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide (NAD+) levels and to evaluate safety of the use of NR.

detailed_description.textblock: The study team chose a treatment protocol with NR as a treatment for patients who will be admitted with COVID-19 related illness and develop AKI after admission. Treatment duration will be for 10 days and the primary study endpoint will be the change in whole blood NAD+ from baseline to end of treatment in NR group vs placebo group. The study team will evaluate whole blood NAD+ levels as a marker of efficacy and biological effect of NR.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Prospective, double-blind, placebo-controlled clinical interventional trial
study_design_info.masking_description: The study drug (NR or placebo) packaging and labeling will be designed to maintain the blinding of the investigator's team and the participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in whole blood NAD+ level
primary_outcome.description: Measure of NAD+ level in whole blood from treatment beginning to end

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Adverse Events of Grade 3 or Higher
primary_outcome.description: Safety of NR in hospitalized patients with COVID-19 and AKI (defined as the occurrence of at least one serious adverse event of grade 3 or higher)
Number occurrences of thrombocytopenia defined as >25% decline in blood platelet count from baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Area under the curve (AUC)
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the effect of NR on changes in AUC serum creatinine from baseline during the 10-day intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of NR on Major Adverse Kidney Events (MAKE)
secondary_outcome.description: Time to first occurrence of MAKE defined as doubling of serum creatinine, the initiation of long-term dialysis, or death from any cause

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR)
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of change in eGFR at 30-90 days post randomization
Measurement of change in proteinuria at 30-90 days post randomization

arm_group.description: Placebo capsules will be administered 2 capsules twice daily for 10 days
Nicotinamide riboside 250mg capsules will be administered 2 capsules twice daily for 10 days

facility.name: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai
The University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio
responsible_party.investigator_title: Holder of the L. David Hillis, M.D. Endowed Chair, Medicine -Renal Diseases
